page.title: 05Mentmore's interesting homes
page.content: Further on the right is an older house called the{Old Avairy,}where Hannah de Rothschild once kept an aviary. A modern house has been built in the former sunken garden there. The{Manor {House}follows, standing behind high brick walls, end on to the road. This has a Queen Anne facade, Elizabethan kitchen quarters and 17th century wood panelling and is a listed building. The high wall encloses a flourishing{ {blacksmith's shop}run by two brothers and specialising in wrought-iron work, with a newly-built extension for the forge. Finally there are 3 dwellings converted from the Bothy once the communal home for unmarried estate gardeners. Apart from the Stable Yard, there are no shops of any description in Mentmore.
